english: A dog is a man's friend.
It's raining, but I have an umbrella.
I love chocolate.
My friend plays the guitar.
I am reading an interesting book.
Watch out, the coffee is hot!
In the morning, I take the dog for a walk.
The car is parked in front of the house.
Breakfast is an important meal.
Will there be any snow this winter?
The sea is calm.
The pizza is quite tasty.
Are you coming to the work picnic?

slovene: S prijatelji smo šli na pivo.
english: We went for a beer with friends.
The bus leaves at nine.
When is the train going?
I train twice a week.
Where are you going for vacation?
Breakfast is ready.
The brain needs enough sleep.
Refošk is a Slovenian wine.
Cycling is good exercise.

slovene: Ob petkih s punco gledam filme in jem pico.
english: On fridays, I watch movies and eat pizza with my girlfriend.
It's time for lunch.
I adore desserts and sweets.

slovene: Brez skrbi, vse bo v redu.
english: No worries, everything will be fine.

slovene: Čez vikend smo šli na izlet.
english: We went on a trip over the weekend.

slovene: Učili smo se iz svojih napak.
english: We learned from our mistakes.
Tomorrow I will go for a walk.
We will meet soon.
School will start in September.
The weather will be nice this week.
Monday will be a strenous day.

slovene: Bi šel v kino z mano gledat novi film?
english: Would you go to the cinema with me to watch the new movie?
Tomorrow I will do the homework.

slovene: Žena bo spekla torto za rojstni dan.
english: Wife will bake a cake for the birthday.

slovene: Gorivo se bo naslednji teden podražilo.
english: Fuel will increase in price next week.
We will participate in the sports competition.
I will visit friends in Slovenia.
I will order a new book.
Dinner will be at seven.
We will go to the shop tomorrow.
Come here!
Look at this!
Open the window, please!
Listen!
Be brave!
Go out!
Bring me water!
Write it down!
Leave it!
Don't give up!
Go to sleep!
Clean the kitchen!
Let's take a break!
Stop crying!
Tell, how it went!
Are you coming with?!

slovene: Če bom imel čas, bom prišel.
english: If I have time, I will come.

slovene: Če bo vreme lepo, bova šla v hribe.
english: If the weather will be nice, we will go to the mountains.
If only I knew.

slovene: Če bi bilo mogoče, bi ostal dlje.
english: If it were possible, I would stay longer.

slovene: Če bi bilo več časa, bi se bolje pripravili.
english: If there were more time, we would prepare better.

slovene: Če bi vedela, da bo deževalo, bi vzela dežnik.
english: If I knew it would rain, I would take an umbrella.
When will you come again?
Why are you so worried?
Do you have any special plans?

slovene: Kdaj si nazadnje šel na morje?
english: When did you last go to the sea?
How quickly can you finish?
What will we eat for lunch?
Where did you buy these shoes?
Why were you late for the meeting?
How often do you go to the gym?
Will the weather be nice tomorrow?
When will you buy a new phone?

slovene: Kako dolgo že poznaš svojega prijatelja?
english: How long have you known your friend?
Have you eaten yet?
Do You know where the library is?
Is the coffee too strong?
Do you like the cake?
What are you doing this weekend?

slovene: Ali si že kdaj jedel suši?
english: Have you ever eaten sushi?
How often do you read?
When did you learn to swim?
Do you have any hobbies?
How do you feel today?
Do you know when the movie starts?
It rained all day yesterday.
Hello! How are you today?

slovene: Dobro jutro! Si se dobro naspal?
english: Good morning! Did you sleep well?

slovene: Živjo! Lepo te je spet videti.
english: Hi! It’s nice to see you again.
Hey there! Are we going for the meeting?

slovene: Ali mogoče veš, kje je najbližja pošta?
english: Do you perhaps know, where the closest post office is?
How much does this sweater cost?
When does the store close today?

slovene: Lahko popust unovčim tudi na že znižane izdelke?
english: Can I use the discount on already lowered-price products as well?
Coffee and a piece of cake, please.

slovene: Lahko dobim še en kozarec vode, prosim?
english: Can I get another glass of water, please?
What do you recommend?
Excuse me, where is the train station?
Is it still far?
Can you show me on the map?
Which way do I have to go?

slovene: Ti je v redu, če se dobimo ob petih?
english: Is it okay with you if we meet at five?
Are you free on Friday?
Shall we meet there?

slovene: Danes je sončno. Pojdiva na kolo!
english: It’s sunny today. Let’s go for a bike!
It looks like it will rain today.

slovene: Ali imaš raje zimsko ali poletno vreme?
english: Do you prefer winter or summer weather?

slovene: Malce je hladno; bolje, da oblečeš jakno.
english: It’s a bit chilly; you should better wear a jacket.
In my free time, I like to read.

slovene: Tvoja obleka je čudovita! Kje si jo kupila?
english: Your dress is beautiful! Where did you buy it?
Your haircut looks fantastic!
Good idea, let's do it.
I have two brothers.

slovene: Raje hodim v naravo kot pa v telovadnico.
english: I prefer hiking in nature to going to the gym.
Where do you work?
This afternoon I have some meeting.
What do you think?

slovene: Si šel kaj v hribe v zadnjem času?
english: Have you gone to the mountains lately?

slovene: Moj mnenje je, da bi morali to narediti drugače.
english: My opinion is that we should do this differently.
Usually in the morning I first eat breakfast.
I go to the supermarket every Saturday.

slovene: Trudim se, da grem spat pred deseto.
english: I am trying to go to sleep before ten.

slovene: Bi šel z mano na kosilo?
english: Would you go with me for lunch?

slovene: To soboto ne morem. Kaj pa v ponedeljek?
english: This saturday I can't. What about on monday?
Thank you for your kind words.

slovene: Cenim tvojo pomoč pri tem projektu.
english: I appreciate your help with this project.
Thanks for the invitation!

slovene: A mi, prosim, pomagaš nesti to težko škatlo?
english: Can you, please, help me carry this heavy box?
My computer somehow isn't working.

slovene: Mi lahko pokažeš, kako se uporablja ta aplikacija?
english: Can you show me how this app is used?
Can you, please, explain?
I need advice.
I’m thrilled!

slovene: Katera mesta naj obiščem, ko bom tam?
english: What places should I visit while I will be there?
I can't wait!

slovene: Boš šel letos na sejem knjig?
english: Will you go to the book fair this year?
Every Saturday I go uphill.
I apologize for mistake.
I’m sorry if I interrupted.
I am sorry for being late.
I’ve been feeling a bit ill.

slovene: Upam, da se bomo še kdaj srečali.
english: I hope we’ll meet again.
